page.title: 20TRANSPORT
page.content: The nearest railway is some twelve miles away. The roads in this area are not major ones and have not been widened or straightened. In many cases they follow the boundaries of fields in a series of right angle bends. On the other hand the traffic using the area, to supply public houses or small shops, includes many large vehicles which at times travel at speeds in excess of safety. The roads are sometimes hedge lined or the fields are higher than the road level. In Winter, snow drifts can cause a 'road' to disappear, or drifting snow can cause drifting against hedges. Some of these 'hedge shaded' lanes do not thaw sufficiently and remain icey for long periods. The heavy lorries break up the edges of the roads.
